chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hakeem Hicks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hakeem Hicks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Hakeem Hicks.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Rydzewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hakeem Hicks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court in person for Hakeem Hicks.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE  for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hakeem Hicks not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Doris Y or Rosa Y.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Hakeem Hicks in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Hakeem Hicks in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hakeem Hicks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
